readme.title: error-chain - Consistent error handling for Rust

sections.heading: error-chain - Consistent error handling for Rust
sections.text:
error-chain
makes it easy to take full advantage of Rust's error
handling features without the overhead of maintaining boilerplate
error types and conversions. It implements an opinionated strategy for
defining your own error types, as well as conversions from others'
error types.
Documentation (crates.io)
.
Documentation (master)
.

children.heading: Quick start
children.text:
If you just want to set up your new project with error-chain,
follow the
quickstart.rs
template, and read this
intro
to error-chain.

children.heading: Supported Rust version
children.text:
Please view the beginning of the
Travis configuration file
to see the oldest supported Rust version.
Note that
error-chain
supports older versions of Rust when built with
default-features = false
.
